claim.claim-text: What is claimed is:
A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition effective against Gram positive bacteria, Gram negative bacteria, fungi, yeasts, molds and viruses comprising the following individual components:
a. from about 0.001% to about 5% of an antimicrobial active; b. from about 1% to about 80% of an anionic surfactant; c. from about 0.1% to about 12% of a proton donating agent;

and d. from about 3% to about 98.899% of water; wherein the composition is adjusted to a pH of from about 3.0 to about 6.0; wherein the rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition has an One-wash Immediate Genn Reduction Index of greater than about 2.5;
and wherein the rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition has a Mildness Index of greater than 0.3.

2. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 1 wherein the antimicrobial active is selected from the group consisting of triclosan, triclocarbon piroctone olamine, PCMX, ZPT, natural essential oils and their key chemical components, and mixtures thereof.
3. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 2 wherein the antimicrobial active is triclosan.

4. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 2 wherein the anionic surfactant has a solubility slope. K, of less than about 0.60 and has a Microtox Response Index of less than about 150.
5. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 2 wherein the proton donating agent is an organic acid having a Biological Activity Index, Z, of greater than about 0.5.
6. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 2 wherein the proton donating agent is a mineral acid.
7. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 5 wherein the composition is adjusted to a pH of from about 3.5 to about 5 0 (slashed zero)
A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 7 wherein the ratio of the amount of non-anionic surfactants to the amount of anionic surfactant is less than 1:1.
9. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 8 which further comprises from about 0.1% to about 35% of a deposition aid.
10. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 9 wherein the deposition aid is a lipophilic skin moisturizing agent.

11. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 10 wherein the anionic surfactant is selected from the group consisting of sodium and ammonium alkyl sulfates and ether sulfates having chain lengths of predominantly 12 and 14 carbon atoms, olefin sulfates having chain lengths of predominantly 14 and 16 carbon atoms, and paraffin sulfonates having an average chain length of from 13 to 17 carbon atoms, and mixtures thereof.

12. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 11 wherein the proton donating agent is selected from the group comprising adipic acid, tartaric acid, citric acid, maleic acid, malic acid, succinic acid, glycolic acid, glutaric acid, benzoic acid, malonic acid, salicylic acid, gluconic acid, polyacrylic acid, their salts, and mixtures thereof.

13. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition effective against Gram positive bacteria, Gram negative bacteria, fungi, yeasts, molds and viruses comprising the following individual components: a. from about 0.001% to about 5% of an antimicrobial active; b. from about 1% to about 80% of an anionic surfactant; c. from about 0.1% to about 12% of a proton donating agent;

and d. from about 3% to about 98.8990% of water; wherein the composition is adjusted to a pH of from about 3.0 to about 6.0; wherein the rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition has a Ten-wash Immediate Germ Reduction Index of greater than about 2.8 and wherein the rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition has a Mildness Index of greater than 0.3.

14. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 13 wherein the antimicrobial active is selected from the group consisting of triclosan, triclocarbon, peroctone olamine, PCMX, ZPT, natural essential oils and their key chemical components, and mixtures thereof.
15. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 14 wherein the antimicrobial active is triclosan.

16. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 14 wherein the anionic surfactant has a solubility slope, K, of less than about 0.60 and has a Microtox Response Index of less than about 150.
17. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 14 wherein the proton donating agent is an organic acid having a Biological Activity Index, Z, of greater than about 0.5.
18. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 14 wherein the proton donating agent is a mineral acid.
19. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 17 wherein the composition is adjusted to a pH of from about 3.5 to about 5 0 (slashed zero)
A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 19 wherein the ratio of the amount of non-anionic surfactants to the amount of anionic surfactant is less than 1:1.
21. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 20 which further comprises from about 0.1% to about 35% of a deposition aid.
22. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 21 wherein the deposition aid is a lipophilic skin moisturizing agent.

23. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 22 wherein the anionic surfactant is selected from the group consisting of sodium and ammonium alkyl sulfates and ether sulfates having chain lengths of predominantly 12 and 14 carbon atoms, olefin sulfates having chain lengths of predominantly 14 and 16 carbon atoms, and paraffin sulfonates having an average chain length of from 13 to 17 carbon atoms, and mixtures thereof.

24. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 25 wherein the proton donating agent is selected from the group comprising adipic acid, tartaric acid, citric acid, maleic acid, malic acid, succinic acid, glycolic acid, glutaric acid, benzoic acid, malonic acid, salicylic acid, gluconic acid, polyacrylic acid, their salts, and mixtures thereof.
25. A method for providing improved immediate germ reduction of bacteria comprising the use of a safe and effective amount of the composition of claim 1 on human skin.
26. A method for providing improved immediate germ reduction of bacteria comprising the use of a safe and effective amount of the composition of claim 13 on human skin.
27. A method for treating acne comprising the use of a safe and effective amount of the composition of claim 1 on human skin.
28. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 1 comprising from about 1% to about 25% of the anionic surfactant.
29. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 13 comprising from about 1% to about 25% of the anionic surfactant.
30. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 1 wherein the ratio of the amount of non-anionic surfactants to the amount of anionic surfactant is less than 1:2.
31. A rinse-off antimicrobial cleansing composition according to claim 13 wherein the ratio of the amount of non-anionic surfactants to the amount of anionic surfactant is less than 1:2.
